$schema.description: The schema to verify this document against.

data.description: dict of options for this apworld

^.*$.description:
An Option for your World, the possible Parameters depend on the type of option you set in "type"
Toggle: "default" 
Choice: "value", "aliases", "default" and "allow_user_input"  
Range: "range_start", "range_end", "default" and an optional "special_range_names"

display_name.description: The name shown on the webhost.

type.description:
The type of this options, check the official Archipelago docs for the options types here: 
https://github.com/ArchipelagoMW/Archipelago/blob/main/docs/options%20api.md#basic-option-classes

description.description: long description of what this option is for(is shown on hover on the webhost)

rich_text_doc.description:
(Optional) support for HTML generated from the standard Python reStructuredText format for your description. 
for more info: https://github.com/ArchipelagoMW/Archipelago/blob/main/docs/options%20api.md#option-documentation

group.description: (Optional) The name of the group this option is a part of on the webhost

visibility.description:
(Optional) (Advanced) Specify where this option can be seen. 
It can be represented by the value names, an array of those, 
the binary string representation of that choice ("0b1111") or the integer value of the binary 
Every example values other than 'none' and 'all' gives the same results aka 14 aka 0b1110 aka that array 
More info at https://github.com/ArchipelagoMW/Archipelago/blob/main/docs/options%20api.md#option-visibility

ChoiceValue.description:
A dict of possible values in the format 'name':int 
the default option is, by default the one with 0 as value

^.*$.description: An int value this option can have

ChoiceAlias.description: A dict of possible values in the format 'name':int/the name of a value from 'values'

^.*$.description: An alias for a value declared in 'values'

ChoiceUserInput.description: Allow the user to set their own string Value

rangeStart.description: The lowest Value for this range

rangeEnd.description: The Highest Value for this range

special_range_names.description:
(Optional) A Special Dictionary in the format 'name':int of named values for this range 
All names need to be lowercase

DefaultInt.description: the default integer value of this option

DefaultToggle.description: the default value of this Toggle

comment.description: (Optional) Does nothing, Its mainly here for Dev notes for future devs to understand your logic
